intro: Baeckea leptophylla, commonly known as the narrow-leaved baeckea, is a flowering plant native to eastern Australia. It belongs to the family Myrtaceae, which includes eucalyptus and tea trees. The plant is characterized by its slender, linear leaves and clusters of small, white or pale yellow flowers. It typically grows in heathlands and open forests, preferring well-drained soils. Baeckea leptophylla is often found in coastal areas and is valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological role in supporting local wildlife.
